insights.description: The monitoring-stack repository showed high cycle time variability in 2021-W33. The P90 cycle time (156.2 hours) was 337.8x higher than P50 (0.5 hours). This suggests some PRs were getting stuck in review or blocked by dependencies.
insights.title: High cycle time variability in monitoring-stack

insights.description: The auth-service repository showed high cycle time variability in 2023-W08. The P90 cycle time (658.3 hours) was 152.5x higher than P50 (4.3 hours). This suggests some PRs were getting stuck in review or blocked by dependencies.
insights.title: High cycle time variability in auth-service

insights.description: The dashboard-api repository has critically slow PR completion times. The P90 cycle time is 40.1 days, exceeding the 5-day threshold. Consider reviewing code review practices or breaking up large PRs.
insights.title: Critical slowdown in dashboard-api

insights.description: PR throughput increased by 23.0% during 2023-W08 to 2023-W11. Average weekly PRs went from 31.8 to 39.0. This surge could indicate a major release push or increased team capacity.
insights.title: PR throughput surge detected

insights.description: PR cycle time decreased by 43.0% during 2023-W50 to 2024-W01. Median cycle time dropped from 10.7 hours to 6.1 hours. This improvement suggests review processes became more efficient during this period.
insights.title: Cycle time improvement detected

insights.description: Week 2022-W05 had 37 PRs, which is 4.1 standard deviations above the 8-week rolling average of 31.3. This spike could indicate a major release, hackathon, or concentrated feature work.
insights.title: High PR activity spike detected

insights.description: Week 2021-W47 had only 30 PRs, which is 4.3 standard deviations below the 8-week rolling average of 36.5. This dip could indicate team absences, blockers, or focus on non-PR work.
insights.title: Low PR activity detected
